Index » node_modules\express\node_modules\proxy-addr\node_modules\ipaddr.js\src\ipaddr.coffee

File: ipaddr.coffee

Defined in: node_modules\express\node_modules\proxy-addr\node_modules\ipaddr.js\src
Classes: ipaddr.IPv4 ipaddr.IPv6

Variables Summary

ipaddr = 
{}

Define the main object

root =
ipv4Part = 
"(0?\\d+|0x[a-f0-9]+)"

A list of regular expressions that match arbitrary IPv4 addresses, for which a number of weird notations exist. Note that an address like 0010.0xa5.1.1 is considered legal.

ipv4Regexes = 
{
  fourOctet: new RegExp("^" + ipv4Part + "\\." + ipv4Part + "\\." + ipv4Part + "\\." + ipv4Part + "$", 'i'),
  longValue: new RegExp("^" + ipv4Part + "$", 'i')
}
ipv6Part = 
"(?:[0-9a-f]+::?)+"

IPv6-matching regular expressions. For IPv6, the task is simpler: it is enough to match the colon-delimited hexadecimal IPv6 and a transitional variant with dotted-decimal IPv4 at the end.

ipv6Regexes = 
{
  "native": new RegExp("^(::)?(" + ipv6Part + ")?([0-9a-f]+)?(::)?$", 'i'),
  transitional: new RegExp(("^((?:" + ipv6Part + ")|(?:::)(?:" + ipv6Part + ")?)") + ("" + ipv4Part + "\\." + ipv4Part + "\\." + ipv4Part + "\\." + ipv4Part + "$"), 'i')
}

Method Summary

  • ~ (void) matchCIDR(first, second, partSize, cidrBits) A generic CIDR (Classless Inter-Domain Routing) RFC1518 range matcher.
  • ~ (void) ipaddr(address, rangeList, defaultName = 'unicast') An utility function to ease named range matching.
  • ~ (void) ipaddr(string)

    Classful variants (like a.b, where a is an octet, and b is a 24-bit value representing last three octets; this corresponds to a class C address) are omitted due to classless nature of modern Internet.
  • ~ (void) expandIPv6(string, parts) Expand :: in an IPv6 address or address part consisting of parts groups.
  • ~ (void) ipaddr(string) Parse an IPv6 address.
  • ~ (void) ipaddr(string) Checks if the address is valid IP address
  • ~ (void) ipaddr(string) Try to parse an address and throw an error if it is impossible
  • ~ (void) ipaddr(string) Parse an address and return plain IPv4 address if it is an IPv4-mapped address

Method Details

~ (void) matchCIDR(first, second, partSize, cidrBits)

A generic CIDR (Classless Inter-Domain Routing) RFC1518 range matcher.

~ (void) ipaddr(address, rangeList, defaultName = 'unicast')

An utility function to ease named range matching. See examples below.

~ (void) ipaddr(string)

Classful variants (like a.b, where a is an octet, and b is a 24-bit value representing last three octets; this corresponds to a class C address) are omitted due to classless nature of modern Internet.

~ (void) expandIPv6(string, parts)

Expand :: in an IPv6 address or address part consisting of parts groups.

~ (void) ipaddr(string)

Parse an IPv6 address.

Checks if the address is valid IP address

~ (void) ipaddr(string)

~ (void) ipaddr(string)
